title: Add Introduction page + navigation links and improve Admin Works upload discoverability

requirements.summary: Add a dedicated public Introduction page that renders the provided English self-introduction with long-form reading styles.
acceptanceCriteria: A new route exists for the Introduction page (e.g., /introduction) and renders a dedicated page with an H1 title "Introduction" and the introduction body text.
The Introduction page uses the existing long-form reading styles (consistent with other content pages, e.g., using the existing Prose component pattern).
All user-facing text on the page is in English.

file_operations.description: Create a new IntroductionPage that follows the same container/max-width pattern as other content pages (e.g., AboutPage) and wraps the introduction body in the existing Prose component for long-form typography.
Register a new public route at /introduction that renders IntroductionPage, ensuring it is part of the router tree so navigation can reach it.

requirements.summary: Add an Introduction link to the top navigation (desktop and mobile) and ensure it highlights as active on the Introduction route.
acceptanceCriteria: The header navigation (desktop) shows an "Introduction" link and it appears before the existing primary sections (Research/Storytelling/Poetry).
The mobile navigation drawer also includes the "Introduction" link.
Clicking "Introduction" navigates to the Introduction page route and highlights as active when on that page.

file_operations.description: Update the header navLinks to include an "Introduction" item (path /introduction) placed before Research/Storytelling/Poetry, and ensure both desktop and mobile menus render it with existing Link active styling. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Make the Admin-to-Works upload path unmistakable for authenticated admins and ensure non-admins see clear authorization messaging for Works uploading.
acceptanceCriteria: When logged in as an admin, the Admin area provides an obvious path to Works management and uploading (e.g., Admin Dashboard has a "Manage Works" action that leads to the Works admin page, and the Works admin page has a visible "Upload Work" button that navigates to the upload form).
The Admin Works upload form allows selecting a file and submitting, and on success returns to the Works admin list.
If the user is not logged in or not an admin, the UI clearly indicates that Works uploading requires admin access (using the existing AdminGuard/authorization messaging patterns).

file_operations.description: Strengthen Works discoverability from the Admin Dashboard by making the Works actions more prominent (e.g., add a clearly-labeled primary action for "Manage Works" and a direct "Upload Work" action that routes to the upload form).

Add an explicit navigation path within the Works admin screen (e.g., a "Back to Admin Dashboard" control) and ensure the existing "Upload Work" button remains visually prominent even when the list is empty.

Ensure the Works upload UX clearly supports file selection and submission with progress, and confirm that successful submission reliably navigates back to the Works admin list; use the blob-storage ExternalBlob flow already present for uploads. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Refine the existing authorization messaging to explicitly mention that Works uploading/management requires admin access while keeping the current AdminGuard pattern and styling; use the authorization componentâ€™s role-based access control behavior already wired into the app. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add an Introduction link to the footer navigation alongside existing public links.
acceptanceCriteria: Footer navigation includes an "Introduction" link that routes to the Introduction page.
All footer links remain functional and styling remains consistent with the existing footer design.

file_operations.description: Insert an "Introduction" Link (to /introduction) into the footer nav alongside the existing public links, preserving existing layout and styling.
